textBox.richText: Today I am simply putting up a small list of works dealing with the wars in the Balkans in the 1990s, wars which led to a vigorous attempt at ethnic cleansing and resulted in the deaths of approximately 100,000. I recently read a book, a graphic novel, called Safe Area Gorazde. It is listed on the Bibliography of Ethnic Cleansing in the Former Yugoslavia page. Written from the perspective of its journalist author Joe Sacco, it did a very good job at making the experiences of Muslim individuals caught in the war in Eastern Bosnia vivid and personal to a reader who has never experienced anything like that. Sacco moved fluidly between the memories of the survivors and the present. Using the medium of the graphic novel, he made a difficult topic readable and understandable to a lay person.
